collector 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • News

    collector

    collector is an R package for conducting interviews with subject matter experts (SMEs) on the risk scenarios facing an organization. It offers functions for the following stages of input collection:

    • generate scenario and capability questions
    • building interview artifacts, including progress card, slide decks, and handouts
    • calibration testing, similar to that promoted by Doug Hubbard and the FAIR Institute
    • opinion pooling
    • distribution fitting
    • generating quantitative data structures for simulation and further reporting by Evaluator

    Installation

    Collector is not currently on CRAN. The following sample code to install will not work until a release is made to CRAN.

    install.packages("collector")

    If you wish to run the development (and potentially bleeding edge) version of Collector, you can install directly from GitHub via the following devtools command.

    # install.pacakges("devtools")
devtools::install_github("davidski/collector")

    Basic Flow

    See the package website for reference. While long form vignettes need to be created, the basic flow for preparing for interviews with your SMEs, processing the results, and generating parameters for simulation via evaluator is:

    1. Build questions and define SME expertise

    2. Read in the questions

      library(collector)

questions <- read_questions()

    3. Generate materials for interviewing a SME

      make_handouts("Leader Name", questions, output_dir)
make_scorecard("Leader Name", questions, output_dir)
make_slides("Leader Name", questions, output_dir)

    4. Read in the answers from your SMEs

      answers <- read_answers()
scenario_answers <- answers$sce_ans
capability_answers <- answers$cap_ans

    5. Fit the SME answers to distributions.

      scenario_answers_fitted <- fit_scenarios(scenario_answers)
capability_answers_fitted <- fit_capabilities(capability_answers)

    6. Combine distributions into final parameters, applying weighting based on each SMEs level of calibration.

      scenario_parameters <- combine_scenario_parameters(scenario_answers_fitted)
capability_parameters <- combine_capability_parameters(capability_answers_fitted)

    7. Build quantitative parameters for evaluator

      scenarios <- prepare_data(scenario_parameters, capability_parameters, 
                          threat_parameters, questions)
